title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: trains resume between london and northampton following a fire near the line in harrow .
services were cancelled all morning but resumed at 13:00 .

documents.title: northampton saints 24-6 bath
text: northampton saints 24-6 bath

documents.title: that 's all from local live
text: our news updates have now come to an end for the day and for the week , and it 's time for us to head off home .
many thanks for your company - we hope you 've enjoyed reading the stories we 've brought you .
have a great weekend and we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: the weekend weather outlook
text: any rain should clear tonight , with showers becoming confined to the norfolk coast .
it 'll be mostly dry by morning with clear spells and a few fog patches .
with temperatures falling as low as 4c ( 39f ) there could be a touch of grass frost in rural areas .
tomorrow will be a day of sunny spells and scattered showers , which could turn heavy with hail and thunder .
top temperature of 15c ( 59f ) .
sunday will start cold , with a touch of frost in rural areas .
any mist and fog patches will clear to leave mainly dry conditions with sunny spells .
there 's a small chance of an isolated shower , which could be heavy and thundery .
weather has more .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: toy tractor taken in workshop raid
text: a quad bike and a classic toy tractor were among items stolen in a burglary in chelveston last week .

between 22:00 on 5 september and 06:00 the day after , offenders broke into a workshop and stole items including a green honda quad bike , a john deere ride-on lawn mower , a nixon pressure washer , logic single-axle trailer and various power tools .
a john deere ride-on toy tractor ( of significant sentimental value to the owners , was also taken .
witnesses or anyone with any information about the stolen property or those involved in the burglary are asked to contact northamptonshire police .

documents.title: women arrested over shooting of man in wellingborough
text: two women have been arrested after an 18-year-old man was shot in wellingborough .
the victim was crossing burns road , near the junction with ruskin avenue , when he was shot at about 13:20 .
he sustained serious but non-life threatening injuries and was taken to hospital for treatment .
the women , aged 23 and 27 , were arrested by officers yesterday afternoon and remain in police custody .
police would like to speak to anyone who saw a white vw golf in the area yesterday or who has information about the attack .

documents.title: northamptonshire cruise to cardiff win
text: northamptonshire cruise to cardiff win
author: Nick Webb
BBC Wales Sport

documents.title: harrow fire : all lines open between london and milton keynes
text: we 've just told you about london euston re-opening after last night 's fire in harrow .

london midland has confirmed that all lines have re-opened between milton keynes central and london euston , but trains in both directions may be delayed by up to 90 minutes , cancelled or revised due to trains and train crew being out of position .
southern services are also currently suspended between milton keynes central , watford junction and shepherds bush .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: harrow fire : london euston re-opens
text: we 've just heard that london euston has re-opened .
a network rail spokesman said trains would run out of euston at 13:00 with an amended timetable .
its statement said that land next to the railway , which was badly damaged by fire overnight , had been `` made safe '' .
passengers should check before they travel with their train operator or visit the national rail website for the latest travel information .
# harrow fire update .
railway reopened .

documents.title: strictly dance reveal
text: this is the moment any strictly come dancing fan looks forward to
today it 's been announced what sizzling dance routine rev richard coles will perform in the hit show when it returns next saturday .
sadly the finedon vicar wo n't be dancing to `` do n't leave me this way '' , but the artistic team do like a religious theme .
they 've gone for a cha cha to there must be an angel ( playing with my heart ) by the eurythmics .
i suppose they did n't want to risk `` devil woman '' .
drumroll find out what our 15 couples are dancing to , for our first live show !

documents.title: harrow fire : wall being demolished
text: work is well under way to knock down an unstable hall in harrow after a fire destroyed it last night .
it means no trains are running on that section of the west coast main line , which runs parallel to the building ,
all services into london euston railway station from milton keynes and northampton are cancelled .
disruption is expected to last for the rest of the day .
the unstable wall at harrow is being demolished .
once complete , we will carry out full railway safety checks .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
keep up the good works lads we need these trains running again .
@ twitterid this is what 's causing all the probs
smashing work : )
murphy 's boys to the rescue again
@ twitterid pallet folks to demolish a wall ? ?
you subbed into network rail .
nice one .
oh hurry up .
people have places to be !
this is ridiculous .
well done !
phew - travel crisis averted

author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: harrow fire : specialist equipment arrives to fix wall
text: as specialist equipment arrives to fix the damaged wall on the west coast main line , we are now turning our attention to other stories going on in the region .
all train services from milton keynes and northampton into london euston are cancelled for the rest of the day , but if anything changes we will of course keep you updated .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: harrow fire : damaged wall being removed
text: london midland says work to remove the damaged wall in harrow after last night 's fire has begun .
because it is unsafe and so close to the west coast main line , all services into london euston from milton keynes and northampton are currently cancelled .
work to remove a damaged retaining wall beside the line has begun lines will remain closed euston - milton keynes
can i use my ticket for the same journey on monday instead ?
tickets will be accepted tomorrow but not on monday i 'm afraid
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: harrow fire : buses running from northampton to wellingborough
text: at northampton railway station buses have arrived to transport commuters to wellingborough station so they can up the midland main line service into london .
it seem to be rather quiet here compared to the scene in milton keynes
where the queues were much longer
and there were more buses
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: harrow fire : disruption expected into the weekend
text: this is going to cause problems on some of britain 's busiest train lines all day and possibly into the weekend .
the fire has damaged a wall right next to the track .
engineers need to knock the wall down , but to do that they must bring in specialist kit and close the line so they can gain access to the site .
not a quick job and that 's assuming all goes to plan .
if the wall damages a rail as it comes down , for example , it could delay things .
you can catch king 's cross east coast trains to scotland/london , but they 'll be busier .
author: Richard Westcott
Transport correspondent

documents.title: harrow fire : suggested alternative routes
text: if you need to get into london euston from northampton or milton keynes today , virgin trains has just released this map of alternative routes .
# vtnew due to a line side fire near wembley , all services between milton keynes central and london euston are currently suspended .
# vtupdate services are still suspended between mkc and eus .
please check live service updates before you travel -
# vtupdate all lines between milton keynes and london euston are shut for repairs .
we expect this situation to last until early afternoon .
# vtupdate we are doing our best to repond as quickly as we can to as many of your tweets as possible .

author: Alex Pope

documents.title: harrow fire : no signs of chaos in northampton
text: the scene at northampton railway station is not that chaotic , despite the problems caused by the blaze in harrow .
there are no queues , which suggests many travellers have decided to stay at home or have found alternative routes by now .
i 've spoken to a few frustrated passengers who 're not able to get a direct train into london euston .
most seem to understand the situation as they realise it ca n't be helped .
if anyone wants to get into london from northampton there seem to be a few options .
you either get a train to milton keynes and be bused to luton , or go to wellingborough station and up midland main line services from there .
author: Sam Read
BBC Look East

documents.title: harrow fire : replacement coaches at mk station
text: commuters are now getting on to buses at milton keynes railway station to take them to luton , so they can get into london .
all aboard the coaches to # luton parkway .
longer journey than usual for passengers travelling # mk to london @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: harrow fire : travellers good humoured at mk station
text: the feeling at milton keynes station today is one of good humour and resignation .

no trains are running to or from london euston on the west coast main line , so if anyone wants to travel from northampton and milton keynes to the capital they 're having to find alternative routes .
passengers are being advised to get on buses from mk to luton .
several staff from network rail , london midland and virgin are on hand to advise passengers on the best alternative routes .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: harrow fire : network rail 'working quickly ' to fix wall by track
text: i 've just spoken to allan spence at milton keynes railway station , who 's the head of passenger and public safety at network rail .
he told me the company was working `` as quick as we can '' , with an unsafe wall by the line at harrow needing to be dismantled and rebuilt .
no services will run on the line `` until it is safe '' , he said .
alternative buses are on offer , saying it was doing its best to get people to their destination .
travellers are being advised to check the national rail website before making their journey .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: no trains running into london from mk
text: i 'm at milton keynes railway station where no trains are going into london euston today after a fire in harrow .
it means this rather busy commuter route looks a little different .
instead travellers are going by bus to luton to up train services there .
disruption is expected to last for the rest of the day and possibly into tomorrow morning .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: 'significant disruption ' on west coast main line trains
text: virgin trains has released a statement after the harrow fire , which is severely disrupting train services into the capital today from milton keynes and northampton .
as things stand trains can run from northampton to milton keynes , but replacement buses are now operating from mk to nearby train stations .

the company says : `` due to a fire near the railway , which is suspected to have involved gas cylinders , all lines are currently blocked between euston and milton keynes , and there will be significant disruption on other parts of the route .

`` other train operators are accepting virgin trains tickets so customers can travel on alternative routes , while virgin trains has also lifted restrictions so that customers do not have to travel on their booked trains , or can also travel tomorrow instead if they wish .
`` we are sorry for the inevitable disruption and delays to journeys . ''

documents.title: wall to be dismantled after harrow fire
text: the retaining wall beside the west coast main line will need to be `` dismantled and made safe '' , says network rail .
it explains that the line will be shut all day
# headstonelane latest update .

east midlands and chiltern railways are accepting london midland and virgin railways tickets .
no services will run between milton keynes and euston at all today , and services from northampton into london are stopping at milton keynes .
francis thomas , from london midland , says only `` travel today if you absolutely have to '' .
alternative travel arrangements and routes are available

author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'big job to fix ' train line after fire
text: the overnight fire at a factory and offices in north-west london will cause train disruption into london from milton keynes and northampton for the rest of the day .
london euston says the fire has `` damaged the trackside retaining wall '' and it is a `` big job to fix '' .
the fire-damaged wall is in `` danger of collapse and needs making safe before trains can safely run '' , a spokesman added .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: buses to take commuters to other stations
text: london midland trains has just confirmed that replacement buses will now run from milton keynes to luton or bedford so commuters can get into london .
this is because no train services are running from mk into london after a fire overnight in harrow .
replacement buses will now run from milton keynes to luton & bedford to connect with @ twitterid services to london

i have no real way of knowing i would be guessing at a scheduled or estimated time i 'm afraid

no timetables available currently we may know a little more in a while we 've just sourced them and are sourcing more

documents.title: 'put your journey off ' if travelling into london from northampton or mk
text: if you are travelling into london from northampton and milton keynes , you are being advised to `` put your journey off '' .
francis thomas , from london midland , says it 's `` not expecting any services today '' along the line , after a fire broke out in a warehouse just before midnight in harrow .
he says no services are expected to run until the `` start of work tomorrow '' because of how close the fire is to the railway line and concerns about a retaining wall and gas canisters .
at the moment he says they 're `` taking it one day at a time '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'big job ' to make train line safe after harrow fire

documents.title: video : harrow fire shows flames shoot into the air
text: below is footage taken of the harrow fire by ani naz .
nearly 60 firefighters were called to the blaze on chantry place , harrow , close to midnight on thursday .
as a result , trains through headstone lane have been suspended .
london fire brigade says a cordon was put in place around the warehouse blaze amid fears propane cylinders might explode .
the blaze is now under control , although 12 residents were told to leave their properties as a precaution .

documents.title: train delays after harrow fire

all services on virgin media trains are currently suspended .

text: cooke fight-back holds up northants

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for the local live feed for today .
the team will be back tomorrow from 08:00 bringing you news , sport , travel , weather and more .
if you want to see what we have been up to today , just scroll through the page to catch up on all the news .
see you tomorrow .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sun and showers ahead
text: rather cloudy with scattered showers across the bbc east region this evening , with the rumble of thunder possible across norfolk .
showers dying away after midnight for most , with clear spells later as the temperature dips to 6c ( 43f ) , although places like santon downham in suffolk and writtle in essex could be lower .
friday will see a mainly dry start , but thickening cloud will bring outbreaks of rain , and then a mixture of sunshine and scattered heavy showers later .
the temperature will peak at about 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: kettering mp warns of 'underfunded police '
text: there 's a warning that police forces could reach breaking point because of the government 's latest pay deal .
ministers are awarding officers a 1 % bonus in the coming year on top of a 1 % rise .
labour fears more cuts to police budgets will follow .

the conservative mp for kettering , philip hollobone , said : `` i 'm sure residents in kettering will welcome this pay rise for the police , but can i join calls for changes to the national policing formula , because counties like northamptonshire are clearly underfunded relative to their peers . ''

documents.title: petition presented to parliament against wellingborough sports pitch
text: a petition with 800 signatures has been presented to parliament opposing plans for a 3g sports pitch in wellingborough .
the town 's conservative mp peter bone handed it in on behalf of people living near to the proposed facility at redwell field on barnwell road .
people campaigning against the plans say the site is for `` recreation , dog walking , wildlife , free football and cricket , running and other sports '' .
the plans have been put forward by wellingborough borough council .
we have contacted them for comment , but they have yet to respond .
author: Kris Holland
BBC News

documents.title: women 's tour cycling could return to daventry
text: daventry could be bidding to stage the start of cycling 's women 's tour again next year .
officials described this year 's grand depart in the town as a `` successful community event with economic benefits '' .
in total , 15,000 turned up along the high street on 7 june to see the riders get under way , with 50,000 people coming out to see that day 's stage which finished in kettering .
the strategy group on daventry district council is due to make the recommendations tonight , with the final decision going to full council .
the event is expected to cost the council £ 50,000 , but they are hoping to raise some of the funds through sponsorship .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: arrests in football stadium loan probe
text: arrests in football stadium loan probe

documents.title: m1 transporter crash victims named
text: m1 transporter crash victims named

documents.title: football ground 'acquired by developer '
text: football ground 'acquired by developer '

documents.title: daventry retirement village to be built
text: a new retirement village in daventry which could house hundreds of people has been granted planning permission .
the village has been designed for people over the age of 55 and will be on the middlemore estate .
as well as accommodation and other facilities it would have a doctor 's clinic , a shop , a restaurant and a creche .
daventry district council approved the plans with one amendment - that traffic and parking controls are put in place to manage and stop overspill parking on farnborough drive .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kettering town 's 'spiritual home ' sold to developers
text: the former home of kettering town football club has been sold to a developer .
the club played at rockingham road from 1897 to 2011 , before moving to nene park , the now-demolished home of rushden & diamonds .
there have been unsuccessful attempts to have the ground listed as an asset of community value .
ken samuel , one of the poppies ' directors , says the club now has to `` move on '' as they did n't have the funds to buy the site back .
the club owned the ground until the 1980s , when it was sold .
mr samuel said : `` it 's very sad , our spiritual home , we will never go back there . ''
the club will continue to play at latimer park in burton latimer .
mr samuel explained they are in talks with the borough council as they hope to find another site in kettering to play on .
`` we have to keep an open mind , '' he added .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sunshine and showers
text: a cool and cloudy start to the day across the bbc east region , with a mix of sunshine and heavy and blustery showers developing later .
remaining breezy , with the north westerly wind making it feel quite chilly .
top temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you are at bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: welcome back to the local live feed for thursday .
this means we 'll be here until 18:00 bringing you news , sport , travel and in a moment a full weather report .
stay with us .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: levi ton gives northants edge in cardiff
text: levi ton gives northants edge in cardiff

documents.title: goodbye from local live
text: that 's it for another day of live news updates - thanks for your company .
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 tomorrow .
do n't forget you can still keep in touch - just click on the `` get involved '' button at the top of the page .
in the meantime , here 's a cheerful shot from our weather watcher 'vaughan 's garden ' of some seasonal reds in earls barton .
have a lovely evening .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : showers aplenty
text: there will be more sunshine and showers and a breezy end to the day .
winds will continue to ease later with clear spells developing .
cloud later with showery rain moving in from the north .
lows of 6-9c ( 43-48f ) .
tomorrow there will be showery rain first thing , which could be heavy on the east coast for a time .
sunny spells and showers later , some being heavy , and it will be breezy and cool .
highs of 14-17c ( 57-63f ) .
for more , head to bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pursglove : 'clock is ticking ' over corby urgent care centre
text: an mp has warned that the `` clock is ticking '' to save a busy medical centre in corby at risk of closure .
tom pursglove says health chiefs reviewing the future of corby urgent care centre face losing it altogether - because a contract with its private operator , lakeside plus , expires in just days .
the conservative mp ( told a parliamentary debate this afternoon that it 's vital it stays open and called for sides to `` get around the table '' .
`` once we get to the end of september that is the cliff edge , '' he said .
`` were that facility to close on 30 september it would be very difficult for it to be reopened . ''
health minister philip dunne also called on health chiefs to extend lakeside 's operating contract on a `` rolling '' basis for the time-being .
`` without an agreement there is no doubt that some of the services would have to be provided in an alternative way and a less satisfactory way if put together in a short time-frame , '' he said .
`` it 's in everybody 's interests to make this work . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brussow to join northampton in january
text: brussow to join northampton in january

documents.title: tory council leader 's plea over funding
text: tory council leader 's plea over funding

documents.title: valtteri bottas signs new mercedes deal for 2018 season
text: valtteri bottas has signed a new contract with northamptonshire-based mercedes to race for the formula 1 world champions in 2018 .
the finnish driver joined mercedes on a one-year deal in january 2017 , as a replacement for retired world champion nico rosberg .
the 28-year-old is third in this year 's drivers ' championship with two wins from 13 races .
team-mate lewis hamilton leads the standings .
bottas is in his fifth season in f1 , having also driven for williams .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: county council launches campaign for fairer government funding
text: county council launches campaign for fairer government funding

documents.title: parliamentary debate later on the future of corby urgent care centre
text: the future of corby 's urgent care centre will be considered in parliament later .
the town 's mp tom pursglove has secured a westminster hall debate on the issue this afternoon .
he is campaigning to save the service , which is under threat due a funding row between operator lakeside plus and the corby clinical commissioning group .
the debate is due to start at 16:00 .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'more funding needed ' for county council
text: northamptonshire county council has launched an appeal to the government for `` fairer funding '' , with tory leader heather smith saying `` we can not carry on as we are , we have reached the end of the road '' .
the authority claims that by 2021 it will be forced to make £ 500m-worth of cuts to balance the books .
it 's chief executive , dr paul blantern , says this is down to the way the government decides what funding each council across the country gets .

the authority says the current funding formula does n't take into account today 's demand levels and northamptonshire 's growing population , saying other councils receive significantly more money per person .
`` we will get through this year 's budget , we might get through next year 's unless government do something really , really significant we can not survive , '' ms smith said .
she added that 75 % of the council 's budget goes on social care , meaning other services will have to be stopped unless there 's changes .
bob scott , leader of the labour group on the council , says he 's `` supporting the campaign '' as northamptonshire has always been `` poorly served in terms of the funding formula '' .
the department for communities and local government said it was working with councils to reform local government finance .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: northampton museum reopening delayed
text: the refurbishment of the northampton museum and art gallery has fallen a year behind schedule .
it closed in february with improvements , including the building of a new extension , being funded by the sale of the egyptian statue sekhemka for £ 16m in 2014 .
it was expected to re-open next year but that date has been pushed back to 2019 .

anna king , conservative councillor for northampton borough council , says the delay has n't been `` mishandled '' and is due to `` unexpected complications '' like the discovery of asbestos and problems with the drains .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: storm aileen : maximum gust 60mph so far
text: if you 've ventured out , you 'll know that it 's a bit breezy this morning with some strong gusts of wind .
just in case you 're wondering - here are the maximum wind gusts for east anglia recorded so far during storm aileen .
it 's not in the same league at hurricane irma , obviously , but enough to bring trees down and send wheelie bins flying .
east anglia max wind gusts so far 60mph weybourne 58mph wittering 56mph lakenheath 53mph marham + norwich apt 52mph andrewsfield + wattisham
you should be relaxing at home lizzie , kate 's on the morning shift today .
make the most of your time off and not think `` weather ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : still windy
text: storm aileen will continue to bring fairly strong gusts of wind today and the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for some areas of the region .
despite the wind , there will be some sunny or bright spells during the day , although some fairly heavy showers are also due to blow in .
the wind will gradually ease through the day .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

we are here until 18:00 to bring you all your news , sport , travel and in a moment a full weather report with kate kinsella .

have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : wet and windy later
text: turning wet and windy later this evening with gusts of 65-70mph possible in parts of the bbc east region .
with these sorts of wind speeds , and with trees still in full leaf , branches could come down .
rain clearing by the early hours leaving clear skies , but remaining very windy .
the temperature will dip to 10c ( 50f )
wednesday will have a mixture of more sunny spells and blustery showers with the possibility of hail and thunder and highs of 17c ( 63f ) .

documents.title: soldiers in court on neo-nazi group charges

documents.title: tuesday 's football : cobblers host portsmouth in league one
text: northampton town will look to record back-to-back victories for the first time this season , when they welcome portsmouth to sixfields later .
the cobblers got their first league one points of the season with saturday 's 1-0 win over doncaster rovers .
victory over rovers came in jimmy floyd hasselbaink 's first match as the club 's new manager , after justin edinburgh was sacked last month .
pre-match stats :
radio northampton will present full match build-up and commentary from 19:00 , but commentary is only on radio and not available online .

documents.title: county championship : northants in action at glamorgan
text: northamptonshire 's cricketers are on top against glamorgan in cardiff on day one of their county championship division two match .
the welsh county are 60-3 , having earlier lost both nick selman and jack murphy in successive overs to the bowling of muhammad azharullah .
northants need to win the four day match to keep alive their slim hopes of promotion from the division .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: two dead in m1 transporter crash
text: two dead in m1 transporter crash

documents.title: corby is 'third worst ' place to be a woman in the uk
text: corby is one of the worst places in the country to be a woman , according to research commissioned by radio 4 's womens hour .
islington , in north london , was rated the worst place for women to live , with corby third on the list behind blackpool .
the national centre for social research analysis factored in issues such as the gender pay gap and education .
it used data from a number of sources , including the office for national statistics ' 2016 annual population survey and the 2011 census .

of all 380 local authorities in the uk , east dunbartonshire came out top for women , rating highly on a number of factors , from happiness to access to green spaces - and top-scoring on general living and wellbeing .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: m1 reopens after lorry crossed carriageway
text: the m1 has reopened in both directions after a lorry crossed the carriageway and collided with other vehicles yesterday .
police said the multi-vehicle collision occurred between junctions 14 and 15 , near northampton , shortly before 15:00 on monday .
the road partially reopened at about 18:00 .
east midlands ambulance service said two people had been taken to hospital - one by the air ambulance - but no further update on injuries has been provided yet .
the other patient was taken to northampton general hospital by land ambulance .

text: giant star wars model built in garden

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : sunny with the risk of showers later
text: a lovely bright start for many of us across the bbc east region , but a little bit more cloud coming in from the west later this afternoon .
in the meantime , enjoy the sunshine while it lasts .
it 'll be quite breezy , but the wind not as strong as yesterday .
as the cloud arrives , we see the risk of a shower this afternoon , but not as heavy or as frequent as yesterday 's .
top temperature 18c ( 64f ) .
things are set to turn very wet and windy overnight - the met office has issued a weather warning for strong winds across much of the region .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

have a lovely evening .

documents.title: overnight weather : largely dry with clear spells
text: there 'll be a few isolated showers but otherwise , it 'll be largely dry overnight across the bbc east region with clear spells and temperatures in rural areas possibly dropping a couple of degrees below 9c ( 48f ) .
moderate westerly wind .
tuesday will start fresh but sunny , and while many places will remain dry , we ca n't rule out a few showers .
temperatures about 18c ( 64f ) with a moderate to fresh west to southwesterly wind up towards the end of the day .
there 's a met office yellow wind warning in place for much of the region .
get a full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: m1 shut after lorry crosses carriageway and collides with vehicles
text: the m1 is closed in both directions between j15 and j14 near milton keynes due to a crash involving a lorry which has crossed the carriageway and collided with other vehicles at about 15:00 .
the east midlands ambulance service has sent three crews and the air ambulance to the motorway
northamptonshire police have closed the road for the emergency services ' activity .
they are advising motorists to avoid the m1 between northampton and milton keynes .
traffic travelling northbound is advised to leave the motorway at j14 and follow signs onto the a509 to the a5/a509 roundabout .
then , they must taker the a5 to the a508/a5/a422 old stratford roundabout and continue on a508 to re-join the m1 at j15 .
traffic travelling southbound is able to follow the northbound diversion in reverse direction from j15 .
motorists are advised to allow extra journey time or to seek an alternative route .
we are currently on scene at a collision on the m1 jct 14/15 southbound with @ twitterid @ twitterid m1 will be closed for sometime
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: abandoned rail electrification scheme spent £ 20m on new bridges
text: about £ 20m has been spent to replace or modify bridges over the railways in northamptonshire in preparation for an electrification scheme that the government has now dropped from its transport plans , the bbc has discovered .
the higher bridges between kettering and kegworth in leicestershire wo n't now be needed to accommodate overhead electric cables .
network rail carried out the work and said the new bridges will be safer and `` are now future-proof '' if the government ever decides to reconsider electrification of the line .
transport minister chris grayling said the new trains on midland mainline would be bi-mode , meaning they could run on electrified sections of track and then transfer to non-electrified sections .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: family tribute to crash victim
text: the family of a man who died in a road crash near inkberrow say their hearts have been `` broken '' .
father-of-two andrew fawcett , 51 , from northampton died after his vehicle collided with a ford ranger on the a422 inkberrow to flyford flavell road at around 15:50 on sunday 3 september .
andrew was a much-loved husband and father to his two children , who he adored .
he had so many plans for the future and our hearts are broken . ''

documents.title: auxiliary raf relocates fire service museum as military exercise
text: plans for a fire and rescue service national museum in northamptonshire have come to an end and a military exercise is under way to move existing exhibits to a site in hampshire .
the county 's royal auxiliary air force is moving the collection of historical fire engines and related equipment from weedon barracks where a museum had been planned .
this scheme has been dropped because of planning problems and funding difficulties .
neil wallington , chairman of the fire services national museum trust , said several different sites had been considered for relocation since 2013 and now one in hampshire has been favoured .

`` my trustees and i feel that the commercial potential and strong public interest in firefighting , fire engines and their equipment , together with the operation of fire brigades and their proud history make for a potential for fireworld to become a national visitor attraction of considerable significance . ''
flt lt kevin winks , from the royal auxiliary air force , said the move operation was `` an ideal opportunity '' to put his drivers through their paces .
`` our role is to train drivers , suppliers and chefs to augment the regular raf .
`` this operation helps drivers to learn to handle non-standard loads - those that do not come in nice neat packages .
`` it offers a number of hazards and challenges and is an ideal opportunity to work in close environments . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: england release five for county duty
text: england release five for county duty

documents.title: rugby union : tigers tamed by saints in east midlands derby
text: it has n't been a great start to the season for one of the big beasts of english rugby , as leicester tigers went down to a 24-11 defeat at northampton saints .
luther burrell and england captain dylan hartley were among the scorers for the hosts , with jonny may scoring a late consolation for leicester .
the tigers are 11th in the table after their pair of defeats , with their next match coming at home to gloucester on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: serial northampton cat killer hunted by police after third animal found
text: a third dead cat 's mutilated body has been left outside an owner 's home in northampton and police are now hunting a serial pet killer .
topsy , 15 , was last seen by her owners at about 19:45 on wednesday on the driveway of their home in brookfield road , kingsley , police said .
her dismembered body was found in a carrier bag on the path outside the front door the following morning .
`` a similar incident happened in the area at the end of august and we know this latest offence will cause concern among pet owners , '' a police spokesman said .

`` topsy 's owners are understandably devastated at the loss of their beloved pet and i would urge anyone who may have seen anything sus or have any information about who may have committed either of these offences , to contact police . ''

some time over the august bank holiday a ginger short-haired cat called rusty ( was butchered and left on the door step of a family home in betjeman court , also on brookfield road , where it was found by the family 's 14-year-old girl .
they had lost another cat a few days earlier .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather : sunny spells broken by blustery showers
text: sunny spells are expected throughout the day across the bbc east region , but broken by blustery showers and these will be heavy and perhaps thundery in places .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f )
